item.title: Hello, World!
item.author: Author
item.description: I learned to code on a computer called the BBC Micro, released by the BBC in 1981 - the year I was born. Coding is a joyous experience, and anyone can learn to do it. pic.twitter.com/y5zy1P2TAE — BBC Micro ðŸŽ„ Bot (@bbcmicrobot) March 1, 2020 Hello, World! is most likely to be the first program you’ll write. It’s a simple way to start, and an easy way to make sure your coding environment works for you.
